name: Talk_Cormag
_source: speak;Eirika;Thank you for joining us, Cormag...
speak;Eirika;If there is anything that you need...|Please let us know.|We'd be happy to help you.
speak;Cormag;...Thank you.|I'm fine. Focus on the battles ahead.
speak;Eirika;Of course.|Just... Let me know if you change your mind.
speak;Cormag;Impressive maneuvering, Princess.|You were able to take over the castle so efficiently.|Are you sure you aren't well-versed in invasion tactics?
speak;Eirika;...This wasn't an invasion, Cormag.|This is a rescue mission.|We're going to rescue the queen, and restore her rule.|We are not like Grado's armies.
speak;Cormag;You're right.|I apologize, Princess...|I suppose I'm too used to fighting for Grado.|It's too easy to assume our battles to be conquests...
speak;Eirika;...I understand.|You'll get there. It's okay.|Just let me know if you find out anything about the Queen...
speak;Eirika;So, Cormag...|Valter is dead. Your brother is avenged|What are you going to do?...
speak;Cormag;Ha... Just as I thought.|That dastard perished, but what do I feel?|Nothing. He's just another corpse in the sand.|What was it all for?

speak;Eirika;Cormag...|It's true, death can't fill the void you feel.|But... You believe in Grado, don't you?|Men like Valter may have dragged it down...|But men like you can help make it right. Can't you?
speak;Cormag;... Believe in Grado?|Ha... I can't imagine what there is to believe in, anymore.|But I believed in it. As so many did...|As my brother did...
speak;Cormag;You're right. I can't let my home be lost.|We will end this war, and then...|Then, I will bring back the greatness I KNOW Grado can hold.|For my brother.|For my countrymen.
speak;Eirika;Cormag...|I cannot thank you enough for your aid...
speak;Cormag;It was nothing.|Are you glad to be back home?|I haven't heard much, but I recall that it's been a while for you.

speak;Eirika;I... I think I am?|It's hard to tell.|This is my home... I'm so relieved...|Yet, my people have suffered so much, under Orson.|How could I let myself be satisfied, when my people languish?

speak;Cormag;Eirika...|My brother was right about you, wasn't he?|About your gentle heart.|I cannot believe I'd consider turning my lance on you...|He'd be ashamed of me, I know it. My apologies, Princess.
speak;Eirika;Cormag...|Don't say such things. You were misled.|And you listened to me, and have aided our cause!|Forget your shame... Your brother would be so proud of you.
speak;Cormag;...I hope he is, Princess.|Thank you.|I will see that his legacy lives on.
speak;Eirika;Cormag, any luck with your wyvern?|Have you found any signs of Lyon?
speak;Cormag;...No.|No signs of the Prince anywhere...

speak;Cormag;...It's funny to me, now.|Hearing Glen speak of your gentle heart...|When all I could think of was our Prince's kindness.|I could hardly believe you his equal, and yet...|Am I to believe this is his true self?
speak;Eirika;...You are not alone.|The Lyon I know is as sweet and gentle as they come...|He would... He would never...
speak;Cormag;...Perhaps we were both wrong.|We'll have to get our answers from him.
speak;Eirika;How are you doing in this heat, Cormag?
speak;Cormag;I'm fine. Can't complain.|Wyverns take the heat well, so Genarog's fine.|If he's alright, I'm alright.
speak;Eirika;Wyverns like the heat?|I didn't know that.

speak;Cormag;They're cold-blooded, Princess.|They tend to roost in warmer places, with just enough shade.|Riders learn early in their training to help their wyvern stay warm...|But not too warm, mind you. It's a balancing act.
speak;Eirika;I see!|Thank you for that trivia, Cormag.|That was enlightening.
speak;Cormag;Any time, Princess.|If we're all business, all the time, we'll burn out.
speak;Eirika;Cormag, I believe we were attacked by a man named Riev.|Do you know anything about him?
speak;Cormag;He was one of the latest men to be promoted to Imperial General.|From what I understand, it was rather controversial.|My brother detested him, on his part.
speak;Cormag;Riev was formerly a priest of Rausten.|But he was exiled, I believe.

speak;Cormag;Details are confidential, but I heard from my brother that...|That he started a cult in Rausten that worshipped demons.|He dealt in foul rituals, too...|Experiments, augmenting men with the might of abominations...
speak;Eirika;That's horrible...|...Cormag...|You don't think... The troops we've been fighting...|The power they've held... Surely he didn't?...
speak;Cormag;...Let's be realistic, here.|With the army ran how it is, by snakes like that...|...There's no telling what they'd do for power.
speak;Eirika;Our final battle is ahead of us, Cormag.|Can I ask you to join us one last time?
speak;Cormag;I'm not going to stop now.|I've got to see this to the end.|My brother would want me to fight for Grado.|No...|Fight for all of Magvel.|Princess Eirika, I will lend you my strength.
speak;Eirika;Cormag...|Let us fulfill Glen's will, together.
speak;Ephraim;A Grado wyvern!|A soldier must have survived!|I will take you down!
speak;Cormag;Halt, I mean you no harm.|I am here to serve under general Duessel.
speak;Ephraim;Oh.|You are under Duessel's orders.|I apologize for the mistake.
speak;Cormag;...I bare no ill will.|I am Cormag, brother of General Glen.
speak;Ephraim;Oh, you are Glen's brother.|Duessel once told me of him.|I heard he is a great man.|Oh, let me introduce myself.|I am Prince Ephraim of Renais.
speak;Ephraim;Is there an issue with that?

speak;Cormag;No.....|No.|I'm just confused.|All the troops in in Grado say how vile the twins of Renais are.|My brother told me otherwise.|Meeting you in person has cleared my doubts of my brother's words.|I'm just confused with Grado and the King's actions.
speak;Ephraim;I see.|I feel the same way.|I hope we can get to the bottom of this.
speak;Ephraim;A Grado wyvern!|A soldier must have survived!|I will take you down!
speak;Cormag;Halt, I mean you no harm.|I am here to avenge General Duessel.
speak;Cormag;But...I bare no ill will.|I am Cormag, brother of General Glen.
speak;Ephraim;Oh, you are Glen's brother.|Duessel once told me of him.|I heard he is a great man.|Oh, let me introduce myself.|I am Prince Ephraim of Renais.
speak;Ephraim;Is there an issue with that?

speak;Cormag;No.....|No.|I'm just confused.|All the troops in in Grado say how vile the twins of Renais are.|My brother told me otherwise.|Meeting you in person has cleared my doubts of my brother's words.|I'm just confused with Grado and the King's actions.|But I will join you if I can help avenge general Duessel's death.
speak;Ephraim;I see.|I feel the same way.|I hope we can get to the bottom of this.
speak;Ephraim;Cormag, you know these waters better than I do.|Will we be close to shore anytime soon?
speak;Cormag;From what I know, it will still be a few days.|This area isn't known to have fast currents.
speak;Ephraim;Drat, I would prefer to get to port sooner than later.|It's a risk to our troops, being on water for too long.
speak;Cormag;Understood.|On the plus side, we're progressing as fast as we could be.|Battles aside.
speak;Ephraim;Right. I suppose it's just a game of patience at this point.
speak;Cormag;Prince Ephraim.|If I may have a quick word?
speak;Cormag;I happen to know this area.|I have been here on business before, with my brother.|I would like to help the locals with any restoration work.
speak;Cormag;Thank you, Sir.|I will get started immediately.|It's what my brother would wish of me.
speak;Ephraim;General Glen...|I bet he's proud to have such an honorable brother.|Yet, he serves Grado, all the same...|I only hope I can get answers from him myself.
speak;Cormag;General Selena...|To see you fall, here.....
speak;Ephraim;Did you know her?|She was honorable to the end...

speak;Cormag;I've speaken with her but a few times, and only with Glen.|She was kind, and selfless. I respect her greatly.|Even then, I can't say I'm shocked it ended like this.|Her loyalty to the king was second to none.
speak;Cormag;...You'd rather she not died, here. Right?|Trust me, Ephraim.|There was nothing you could've said that would've changed her mind.
speak;Cormag;Prince Ephraim, if I may.|Would you aid me in searching these documents?
speak;Cormag;Records of the Grado Army and it's movements.|If I can find where my brother is stationed...|I have faith he would serve you as I have.
speak;Ephraim;I'd be glad to have Glen among our ranks.|Sure, let me just... Look...
speak;Ephraim;Aha!|Here, I see your brother's name!
speak;Cormag;Thank you!|Now, let me see. Where are you?...
speak;Cormag;Who killed him?!|There's more. I have to...|No, I NEED to see...
speak;Ephraim;Cormag!|Calm down!|Are you sure it was that man, Valter?

speak;Cormag;Certain?!|How could I not be?!|Look at this, Prince. LOOK.|His handwriting, his signature...|A gleefully signed death warrant.|Is this what my brother's life was worth?!|Who does he think he is?!|He will pay...|I WILL END HIM!!!
speak;Ephraim;So, Cormag.|Valter is dead. Your brother is avenged.|What now?
speak;Cormag;Ha... Just as I thought.|That dastard perished, but what do I feel?|Nothing. He's just another corpse in the sand.|What was it all for?

speak;Ephraim;...Cormag...|It's true. Valter was a callous monster, and died for it.|And it's not going to bring anyone back. Certainly not Glen.|Grado's lost a lot of good men, Cormag.|It needs people like us, willing to put it back together.|Dare I say, people like you.
speak;Cormag;...Good men...|Ha... So many I knew, so many I respected...|They're really gone, aren't they?|They deserve to see the Grado they loved, flourishing again...

speak;Cormag;You're right. I need to honor my brother, and his peers.|I'll start by bringing this war to a close.|Then... Then, I can help Grado rebuild.|Maybe, just maybe, I can bring back the Grado Glen loved...
speak;Ephraim;Thank you, Cormag.|You're not alone. I promise, we will restore your home.|Together...
speak;Ephraim;Cormag.|Thank you for aiding us thus far.
speak;Cormag;It was nothing.|Are you glad to be back home?|I haven't heard much, but I recall that it's been a while for you.

speak;Ephraim;...What is there to say?|It's my home. I've dreamt of it for months.|But the last time I saw it... I ran from my duty.|I chose my lance over my people, and they suffered.|I'm disgusted at our foes... but also at myself.

speak;Cormag;Ephraim...|Perhaps you were not home to take the throne, but you are here, now.|If you want to honor your people, and your father, fight for them.|We're made by what we do, not what we don't.
speak;Ephraim;...Hah... You think so?|You're right. No point in wringing my wrists.|I've quite an example to live up to, in regards to honoring the fallen...
speak;Cormag;Hah! You honor me, Prince.|I just wish to do my brother proud.|I will see that his legacy lives on.
speak;Ephraim;Cormag, any luck up there?|Have you seen Lyon?
speak;Cormag;...No.|No signs of the Prince anywhere...

speak;Cormag;...It's funny to me, now.|We've known our Prince only for his kindness...|For the care he shows us all.|He was to lead us all into a prosperous new age...|Am I to believe he was some cowardly tyrant?
speak;Ephraim;...Knowing him for his kindness is right.|This isn't like him. Not at all.
speak;Cormag;...Well, who's to say what's like him?|The only person who can tell us is him.
speak;Ephraim;You're not taking the heat poorly, are you, Cormag?
speak;Cormag;I'm fine. Can't complain.|Wyverns take the heat well, so Genarog's fine.|If he's alright, I'm alright.

speak;Cormag;They're cold-blooded, Prince.|They tend to roost in warmer places, with just enough shade.|Riders learn early in their training to help their wyvern stay warm...|But not too warm, mind you. It's a balancing act.
speak;Ephraim;Huh! I...|I almost remember something like that.|Either way, thank you for telling me this.
speak;Cormag;Hah! Seems you learned a bit more about wyverns than I thought!|Maybe we should ride together, sometime.
speak;Ephraim;Cormag, I've a question for you.|A man named Riev led these forces.|I presume he's a general, but I know nothing about him.
speak;Cormag;Makes sense... He's an Imperial General, but he's the newest one.|His promotion was very controversial, if I recall correctly.|My brother rather detested him, personally.
speak;Ephraim;Even at the time?|I can understand now, with my own experience, but...
speak;Cormag;Riev was formerly a priest of Rausten.|But he was exiled, I believe.
speak;Ephraim;Exiled... I can only imagine why.

speak;Cormag;Details are confidential, but I heard from my brother that...|That he started a cult in Rausten that worshipped demons.|He dealt in foul rituals, too...|Experiments, augmenting men with the might of abominations...
speak;Ephraim;...What a sick man.|Yet, I can't help but think...|The closer we got to the capital, the more grotesquely powerful the troops were.|Was that his doing?
speak;Cormag;...That's exactly what I was thinking.|With the army ran by men like him and Valter...|I can only imagine what they did to those men.
speak;Ephraim;Our final battle is ahead of us, Cormag.|Can I count on you, one last time?
speak;Cormag;I'm not going to stop now.|I've got to see this to the end.|My brother would want me to fight for Grado.|No...|Fight for all of Magvel.|Prince Ephraim, I will lend you my strength.
speak;Ephraim;Cormag...|Let us honor your brother's memory, together.
